top_categories.workout_context: The GRiT Adventure’s washington cascades, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The GRiT Adventure rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at The GRiT Adventure when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing The GRiT Adventure isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of The GRiT Adventure. Make this intensity feel like home.
The GRiT Adventure’s 5,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The GRiT Adventure’s washington cascades gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at The GRiT Adventure — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The GRiT Adventure’s washington cascades gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for The GRiT Adventure’s 5,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for The GRiT Adventure — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at The GRiT Adventure count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for The GRiT Adventure’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at The GRiT Adventure. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The GRiT Adventure requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on washington cascades gravel to build confidence. Expect: washington cascades, mountain gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 65 miles of washington cascades gravel in Snoqualmie Pass, WA.
